meanings.sent1: The esne worked hard in the fields all day.
meanings.sent2: The king owned many esnes who served him faithfully.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended to be esnes for a day, playing a game of pretend.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive ruler treated his people like mere esnes, devoid of freedom.
meanings.sent5: In the ancient kingdom, an esne's life was filled with toil and hardship.

meanings.definition: To enslave or make a serf.
meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer sought to esne the entire village with his dark magic.
meanings.sent2: The conquerors would esne the defeated soldiers and force them into labor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children tried to esne their friends into doing their chores for them.
meanings.sent4: The addiction seemed to esne him, trapping him in its grasp.
meanings.sent5: The powerful warlord aimed to esne all who opposed him, bending them to his will.
